questions.text: The image given below shows neuromuscular monitoring of the patient after anesthesia. What is the most commonly used nerve for monitoring?

A 54-year-old man with hypertension and hyperlipidemia who came to the emergency department with chest pain wants to know if he is having a heart attack. Test A is newly available for diagnosing myocardial infarction (MI). In a recent study, the results of test A (compared to a gold standard diagnosis of MI) were as follows. The patient has a positive result on test A. Assuming his pre-test probability is equivalent to the prevalence of MI in the study, what is the probability that the patient has an MI?

A 28-year-old woman comes to the OPS due to a painful leg ulcer that has been expanding over the last 2 months. She has a history of Crohn disease, which has been well controlled for the past 2 years with azathioprine. The patient works as a gardener. The remainder of the physical examination is normal. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Couple has given birth to their first child, the family is entering in which phase:
A capnograph obtained from an intubated patient undergoing controlled ventilation is given below. Which of the following is a likely cause of the finding seen?
Correct statement about the image shown below:

options.label: B
options.text: Higher height of age pyramid means low life expectancy

options.label: C
options.text: If the middle part is bulging means more males compared to females

options.label: D
options.text: A broad apex of age pyramid means more working population.

questions.text: A 2-day-old boy is evaluated in the newborn nursery for a diffuse rash that developed this morning and appears on the patient's face, chest, abdomen, and extremities. He has been breastfeeding every 2-3 hours and voiding frequently. The infant was born at 40 weeks gestation to a 30-year-old woman by vaginal delivery, His mother occasionally develops cold sores during stressful events, most recently a year ago. The mother also had chickenpox as a child. Physical examination shows scattered, blanching, erythematous papules and pustules that spare the palms and soles. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Bacterial blood culture and intravenous antibiotics

options.label: B
options.text: Contact isolation and cessation of breastfeeding

options.label: D
options.text: Viral DNA testing and intravenous antiviral therapy

questions.text: All of the following are true except: TBA, ANM, AWW are grassroot, village level workers. JE SA-14-14-2 is a live attenuated vaccine injected subcutaneously at a dose of 0.5ml in the left upper arm MMR is contraindicated in a child with SCID STEPS approach for WHO includes Behavioral, physical and psychological measurements

A patient presented with headache, vomiting, and fever. Meningitis was suspected. While performing a lumbar puncture, which is the last structure you will pierce just before entering the lumbar cistern?

A research group conducted a placebo-controlled clinical trial to assess whether a new drug to treat acute migraine with or without aura in adults is more effective than standard therapy. During the data analysis phase, the researchers decide to set alpha at 0.01 rather than 0.05. Which of the following is the most likely result of this change?

options.label: A
options.text: Any significant findings will be reported with greater confidence

options.label: B
options.text: There will be a higher probability of a type I error

options.label: C
options.text: There will be a higher probability of finding statistically significant results

options.label: D
options.text: The study will have more statistical power

questions.correct_answer: A. Any significant findings will be reported with greater confidence
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Any significant findings will be reported with greater confidence

A group of researchers conduct a study to evaluate the pharmacologic properties of oxfendazole, an anthelminthic agent. As part of the study, increasing oral doses of oxfendazole (0.5 to 60 mg/kg) are administered to 20 healthy volunteers. Data is collected to form a pharmacokinetic profile of the drug and its metabolites, and the incidence of adverse effects is recorded for the various dosages. Which of the following best describes this type of study?
Identify the Mallampati class of this patient?
Under NVBDCP, the drug combination shown below can be given under which dose combination?

A 4-week-old boy is brought to the OPD for his first well-child visit. He has been exclusively breast-fed since birth and has had normal urine and stool output. The patient takes supplemental vitamin D and no other medications. His 4-year-old brother has neurofibromatosis but is otherwise healthy. There is a 5-cm skin lesion with overlying hair on the upper back, as shown below. The remainder of the skin examination is unremarkable. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

Which of the following criteria is sufficient to start MDT? More than five hypopigmented patches A Hypopigmented patch with sensory loss Peripheral nerve thickening Peripheral nerve thickening with sensory loss Skin biopsy demonstrating bacilli
All are correct statements about Indian health care system except:

options.label: A
options.text: One male health assistant is per 5000 population in plain areas and 3000 in hilly areas

options.label: B
options.text: Minimum number of beds in CHC is 30

options.label: C
options.text: Urban PHC caters to a population of 50000, which a metro CHC caters to 5 lakh population

options.label: D
options.text: School health program is managed by PHC

questions.correct_answer: A. One male health assistant is per 5000 population in plain areas and 3000 in hilly areas
questions.explanation: Ans. A) One male health assistant is per 5000 population in plain areas and 3000 in hilly areas

questions.text: A medical student is conducting a chart review of patients admitted to the local emergency department with acute pancreatitis. He is interested in comparing blood glucose levels between mild and severe cases. Blood glucose levels in patients with severe acute pancreatitis were found to have a strong positively skewed distribution. Which of the following is most likely to be true regarding the data for the severe acute pancreatitis group?

options.label: A
options.text: The mean is equal to the mode

options.label: B
options.text: The mean is greater than the median

options.label: C
options.text: The median is greater than the mean

options.label: D
options.text: The mode is greater than the mean

questions.correct_answer: B. The mean is greater than the median
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The mean is greater than the median

questions.text: Match the following Mapleson circuits with the features described:

A group of geneticists plans to conduct a study on the distribution of allelic variants for a particular gene in a rat population. In the sample population of 15 rats, the genotype distribution is 5 AA, 5 Aa, and 5 aa. The phenotypes represented by the various allele combinations do not provide any specific benefit for survival. During the study, rats will be allowed to mate randomly, but no new rats will be introduced to the population. Based on the information provided, are the current allele and genotype frequencies in this population in Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium?

options.label: A
options.text: No, because there is no selective advantage for this gene

options.label: B
options.text: No, because this is an isolated community with no genetic diversity

options.label: C
options.text: No, because this population size is too small

options.label: D
options.text: Yes, because these features contribute to a stable gene pool

questions.correct_answer: C. No, because this population size is too small
questions.explanation: Ans. C) No, because this population size is too small

questions.text: All of the following are contraindications in IVRA except:

An 11-year-old boy is brought to the OPD by his parents due to a pruritic skin rash for 2 weeks. The rash started on his hands and subsequently spread to the trunk and lower extremities. His mother reports that the patient is constantly scratching the rash and his sleep is now disturbed due to intense pruritus. A cousin who recently visited and shared a room with him had similar symptoms. The patient has had no fever and is up to date with routine vaccinations. Physical examination shows numerous 2- to 3-mm erythematous papules and vesicles with excoriation on his neck, hands, feet, and waistline. His chest and proximal arms and legs are unaffected. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial intervention in management of this patient?
A 16-month-old child with 8 kg weight is assessed on a growth chart, the child falls in the zone between -2SD and -3SD. What should be do for the management of the child?
questions.correct_answer: C. Home based-nutritional care, growth monitoring
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Home based-nutritional care, growth monitoring

questions.text: A 60-year-old patient with a history of severe (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease presents for an elective hernia repair. The patient has a forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) of 60% predicted and requires supplemental oxygen on activity. Under what ASA-PS classification would you place him?

Officials of a public health department report a higher than normal prevalence of AML among children age 5-12 in their community. They observe that some households in the community are exposed to chemical waste from a nearby factory and worry that exposure to this waste is responsible for the increased prevalence of AML. A case-control study is designed to evaluate the health department officials' claim that exposure to chemical waste is associated with AML in childhood. Which of the following populations should be selected as the control group?

options.label: A
options.text: Children who do not have AML and are exposed to chemical waste

options.label: B
options.text: Children who do not have AML and are not exposed to chemical waste

options.label: C
options.text: Children who do not have AML, regardless of exposure status to chemical waste

options.label: D
options.text: Children who have AML, regardless of exposure status to chemical waste

questions.correct_answer: C. Children who do not have AML, regardless of exposure status to chemical waste
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Children who do not have AML, regardless of exposure status to chemical waste

This morning, the parents noted erythema and peeling skin around her mouth, axillae, and inguinal areas. Slight focal pressure to the back results in sloughing of the top layer of skin with underlying erythema. The face appears edematous, with perioral crusting. No mucosal lesions are seen. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

questions.text: A 16-year-old boy comes to the OPD due to a skin condition. For the last 3 years, he has had small "pimples" on the posterior surface of her upper arms. options.text: Prophylaxis for Pneumocystis carinii Pneumonia (PCP) is indicated when CD4 count is <500/ul

options.label: B

questions.text: An 8-year-old previously healthy girl is brought to the OPD by her mother due to hair loss on the scalp. The child recently changed to a different school and has been anxious about new teachers and friends. Skin examination findings are shown in the image below. Researchers are interested in the association between colorectal carcinoma and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug use. They first interview a group of patients with biopsy-proven colorectal carcinoma and then interview a group consisting of the patients' neighbors who are of similar age and race. A 65-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a nonhealing ulcer on the left upper extremity. For the last 2 months, he has had an enlarging ulcerated lesion, with intermittent bleeding and itching. In the last 3 weeks, the patient has also noted local numbness, paraesthesia, and burning pain. He does not recall any injury prior to the onset of symptoms. A 23-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to hair loss. Two weeks ago, she suddenly developed loss of large numbers of hair fibers when washing or brushing her hair. The patient has had 2 pregnancies; the first led to a spontaneous abortion at 13 weeks, and the second led to a normal term vaginal delivery 4 months ago. She subsequently experienced severe postpartum unipolar major depression requiring psychiatric hospitalization. Current medications include fluoxetine and olanzapine. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for this patient's hair loss?

During the vacation, she had sun exposure on several occasions without prior application of sunscreen. The lesions are mildly itchy but not painful. questions.text: A 26-year-old man comes to the OPD due to upper and lower limb skin lesions that have been present for the past week. The lesions started as small, red papules that gradually enlarged but are not painful or pruritic. options.text: Contact with an individual having similar lesions

options.label: C
options.text: Recent bite from an Ixodes scapularis tick
